comments:
When the framework is shutdown it attempts to stop the running application.  It is possible to get the following IllegalStateException if the app already finished running before a call is made to force it to stop.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: This instance of the application has been stopped:  org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench.0
at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.getState(EclipseAppHandle.java:69)
at org.osgi.service.application.ApplicationHandle.destroy(ApplicationHandle.java)
at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.stop(EclipseAppHandle.java:172)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.shutdown(EclipseAppLauncher.java:133)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAdaptorHook.frameworkStopping(EclipseAdaptorHook.java:150)
at org.eclipse.osgi.baseadaptor.BaseAdaptor.frameworkStopping(BaseAdaptor.java:288)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.shutdown(Framework.java:614)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.SystemBundle$1.run(SystemBundle.java:169)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:797)
